comments: An extremely well-spoken and intelligent professor. Lectures are both interesting and insightful. This class is VERY reading intensive, so be prepared for that. There are several written assignments and presentations, but they are short and not very time consuming. Recommended.

She\'s very intelligent and a great communicator. Interesting lectures. Although, so many assignments due each week and so much reading and research. You will also do one presentation each week. So much work and it\'s not a quantitative class. Why? Too much work grading is tough. You won\'t get an A since she grades tough on word usage. Tough! Take he

Professor brings her real world experience to the lectures and is very intelligent is a PhD. The caliber professor that I really appreciate. Will grade tough on your grammar, but it helps you become a better writer. Lots and lots of tiny assignments - too many. Learned a lot! The university is lucky to have her.
Highly recommended. Very engaging, enthusiastic, & clear. Encourages dialogue. Has clear standards but does not overwork students. Lots of practical experience to share.
Professor David is a nice lady, class is kinda interesting. Quite a few short assignments but easy to do. She grades easy, class usually gets out an hour early.
